1555515 THE INDIAN EVIDENCE (AMENDMENT) ACT, 2002
ACT NO. 4 OF 2003 [ 31st December, 2002.]
An Act further to amend the Indian Evidence Act, 1872.
BE it enacted by Parliament in the Fifty- third Year of the Republic of India as follows:-
1943690 1Short title.- This Act may be called the Indian Evidence (Amendment) Act, 2002.
1248831 2Amendment of section 146.- In section 146 of the Indian Evidence Act, 1872 (1 of 1872) (hereinafter referred to as the principal Act), after clause (3), the following proviso shall be inserted, namely:- " Provided that in a prosecution for rape or attempt to commit rape, it shall not be permissible to put questions in the cross- examination of the prosecutrix as to her general immoral character.".
541808 3Amendment of section 155.- In section 155 of the principal Act, clause (4) shall be omitted. SUBHASH C. JAIN,
Secy. to the Govt. of India.
